alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 12:14AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cook County through 1245 AM CDT... At 1213 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles northeast of Eagle Mountain, to 8 miles southwest of Grand Marais, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cook County, including the following locations... Tom Lake, Grand Portage Reservation, Judge C. R. Magney State Park, Judge Magney State Park, Watab Lake, Clearwater Lake, Swamp Lake, Pine Lake, Devil Track Lake and Grand Portage State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northeastern Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore
